description: From Middle English purveyen, from Anglo-Norman purveer, purveir et al., Old French porveeir, porveoir, from Latin prōvidēre (“to provide”). Compare provide, a doublet.

verbs.description: purvey (third-person singular simple present purveys, present participle purveying, simple past and past participle purveyed)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, obsolete) To prepare in advance (for or to do something); to plan, make provision.

examples: Those who sell their own products are distinguished from purveyors, who purvey what others produce.
